What is the primary purpose of mitosis in multicellular organisms?
hint: This process allows organisms to increase their cell numbers.

title: During which phase of the cell cycle does DNA replication occur?
hint: This phase is part of interphase and follows the G1 phase.

title: Which structure is responsible for organizing the mitotic spindle?
hint: This organelle contains the centrioles in animal cells.

title: What is the role of spindle fibers during mitosis?
hint: These fibers attach to chromatids and pull them apart.

title: Which phase of mitosis is characterized by the alignment of chromosomes along the metaphase plate?
What occurs during anaphase of mitosis?
answer: Sister chromatids are pulled to opposite poles.
choices: Sister chromatids are pulled to opposite poles.
hint: Chromatids are separated during this phase.

title: Which type of cells are produced by mitosis?
hint: The daughter cells have the same genetic material as the parent cell.

title: In which part of the plant does mitosis primarily occur?
hint: This region is where growth occurs in plants.

title: What is cytokinesis?
hint: This process follows mitosis and completes cell division.

title: What phase follows telophase in the cell cycle?
hint: This is the final step in cell division.
